titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an George Edward Moore, [10. 9. 1934]
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original bei Timothy Moore; Kopie im BA. Publiziert (Letters, S. 163; deutsch: Briefe, S. 187f.; Cambridge Letters, S. 257; WiC, S. 232).

list.item: 2007/06: Conversion from Folio Flat File to XML

div.p: Thanks for your letter. I wish to God you would attend my classes! It would give me ever so much more of a chance to make things clear, to you & to others. Would you come if I promised you to provide a very comfortable chair & tobacco & pipecleaners? I came up a week ago & am leaving for Ireland on Friday & shall be back again on October 1st. I shall try to see you on Tuesday Oct. 2nd, i.e. I'll call & see if you are in. â€’ I'm extremely sorry about Priestley!
